comment: Typical reading for literature... Not bad. Weekly assignments... Usually one... Plus a midterm paper. Read her feedback and revise the first paper to get a better grade. Knows her stuff... She wrote a book.
rating_tags: Caring--Respected--Online Savvy

comment: Weekly reading is manageable and enjoyable ... This is English lit. One assignment a week, two SHORT papers. Grades fairly. You can revise the first paper. Gives good feedback.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment:
Fair grader and cares about teaching her students. 
Workload is on the highest side of the scale that I've come across. 
Her chosen reading materials make of some of the worst and most painful reads I've had to endure, but there are some pretty decent ones as well.
I wouldn't take her again if I could help it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Gephardt is a nice lady and has a passion for what she teaches, but this 2000 class had more work than my two 4000 ENGL classes combined! The amount of reading & annotations is ridiculous. I looked at summaries for everything just to keep up, so I didn't even learn much. I hate when professors give student more than we can handle.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Gephardt is a really great professor, the guidelines on the assignments are kind of hard to decipher, but she allows you to revise all the essays except for the final essay, but walks us through drafting because she genuinely wants us to be successful, and always gives great feedback so we can do better on the next assignment.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor recommend taking this class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Gephardt is so kind and ready to listen to her students. Though she assigns "high stakes" papers, she walks you through the writing process, and gives a lot of points for participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Gephardt was a pretty good teacher. Nothing out of this world but she wasn't the worst I've ever had. I will say one of the only critiques I have of her is that she is not clear on her grading criteria. She gives very few instructions on what to do for homework and essays, but then grades them strictly. I had to guess what she wanted.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I'll admit the iffy reviews on here made me anxious to take her class, but Prof. Gephardt is really a great teacher. I thought that the majority of the work assigned was super easy (even when I didn't do the assigned readings). She is super sweet and I'm already planning on taking her again next semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Seems like a nice person, but the way she laid out the class made ZERO sense. Had at least 3 things due a week on top of reading several chapters or watching a movie. Did not allow a good balance b/w other classes. Any time you critiqued the work load, she responded that we should be grateful b/c this was a lighter load compared to pre-covid.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One thing she needs to improve on are her quizzes. She sometimes likes to create questions and grade them based on her own opinions rather than actual facts from the text. If you want us to learn something at least make it make sense. So irritating to know you got a question right but according to her own views she marks it wrong.

Does not give clear instructions on assignments. She then grades based off of criteria she never even mentioned you should have included in the assignment. Would not take again simply based off of her confusing grading methods and deducts heavily based off of unmentioned assignment requirements.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Dr. Gephardt knows her stuff. She isn't always the clearest when assigning projects/papers but if you just ask for clarification, she's more than happy to explain it differently and provide examples. She breaks writing processes down to simple steps that anyone could do. She is an amazing professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Currently in her ENGL 2145 class. She is very easy-going and approachable outside class. She makes it clear what she expects from you, thus making it easy for one to succeed. Follow her rubrics closely, do the readings, and you'll do well in this class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this professor for an online summer class and I really enjoyed it! It was a lot of work, but I think it was all beneficial. She gives very clear rubrics, so as long as you follow those you will do fine on assignments. Lots of reading, but if you are an English major that should be expected. Honestly sad I can't take her for another course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took Dr. Gephardt's online summer course. She does have a lot of assignments so I wouldn't recommend her if you're taking a full load or working. However, I really enjoyed her course! If you do all the assignments and participate in the discussions you're bound to get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I loved this class. There is a good bit of reading, but it feels more like a book club than a class. I've taken Gephardt three times and she has been great every time!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Don't take her for summer unless you have a lot of time on your hands. If you always read no matter how many pages or stories there are, you'll do fine. If you're trying to get an easy passing grade, this is not the class for you. I'm trying so hard not to drop her online summer class right now and it's killing me.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Gephardt is wonderful. I left her class having actually learned something and I am definitely a much improved writer. She sets you up for success. Show up to class and participate. Engage the other students and take the opportunities that she give you to improve. She is caring and so intelligent. I highly recommend her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Overall I really enjoyed her class due to the fact that Victorian Poetry excites me, but the problem with this class was that she was porting a Maymester class over to a semester long class and unfortunately we didn't have the amount of time to go over everything she wanted so it felt rushed with too many things we never got to go over.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Gephardt is an amazing professor!  She cares about the students and wants to ensure that you understand the material.  The class is not easy, but she gives you all of the tools to succeed and do well.  All papers are graded and feedback is provided.  You can rewrite your paper if you get anything less than an A. She drops the lowest test grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I LOVE Dr. Gepardt!  This is my third class with her and I'm so sad that there is nothing else I can take from here at this point.  She is not "easy" but she makes the class so enjoyable that it will seem easy.  Do your readings and actively participate and you will do well with her.

You will become such a better writer if you take this teacher! Love the roundtable type setting, small groups working together. Her accent is strong, but she is very patient, open door policy. Will give you all the help you need. LOTS of reading/writing/reviews, etc. but very well worth taking. Her class was so much fun, you didn't want to miss!

Take this teacher! Required course, but when finished you will have learned how to write, all kinds of papers. She works with you, and allows rewrites for a better grade if you get below a 90. Attendance mandatory! You work in a round table/discussion setting and you have a team every week. She is so wonderful,  of her students, loves your opinions
Online class, great professor. There were a few book choices I didn't like but over all it was great. Definitely taking her again.

Amazing teacher! Intelligent and enthusiastic, willing to help, papers are easy because she lets you submit a draft first. Chooses interesting literature--we read a graphic novel! Engaging class discussion, and VERY good at hybrid classes--vista was very organized and easy to navigate. Impossible to misunderstand assignments. Love her!

Very nice and passionate about her subject. Hybrids probably aren't a good idea for her, tho--has difficulty realizing how to properly compensate for the amount of work lost for the other day. I would have enjoyed this class more if I didn't feel like I had to power-read thru stuff just to get everything read. I wanted to enjoy the literature more.
She is a very nice person, but I was bored out of my mind. The books chosen were also very boring. She is also kinda stuffy in a one on one conversation.

I had her for two English courses and she is a great professor. I will admit that it was time-consuming juggling both at once with all the required reading and writing, but she is very knowledgeable and helpful. There should be no surprises if you're an English major.

The person 4 comments down has no idea what they're talking about. We read the Tempest and Wuthering Heights. Not obscure. She goes out of her way to make sure you understand the material, provokes interesting discussions, and yes, there is a lot of writing and reading but that's expected in an ENGLISH MAJOR. I loved her! Take her if possible!!!

This professor gives a lot of work. It is a hybrid class and does not give enough time to read the assignment and do the assignment that is due.I am an English major but gosh I have enjoyed all my classes except this one.

I found her class to be brilliant. Yes you do reading responses, yes you write papers, yes there is a lot of reading... but if you are serious about being an English major, that's supposed to be a "No Duh" to begin with... I loved going to her class. One of my favorite professors!

I dig her; she is very knowledgeable and easy to approach. The workload in class is moderately heavy, but it's not unreasonable. My only problem with her was that she takes attendance; I know most professors do, but mandatory attendance is ridiculous and childish. This isn't high school anymore.

This teacher is by far one of the most incompetent teachers I have had. The class I had was a hybrid, so thank god I only had to see her once/wk. The rest was online discussion, but the prompts were uninspiring and god forbid you actually made a good pt, b/c she would pick you out in class to talk about it by yourself. Her book choices are obscure.

She taught a hybrid class in which we read Dickens' serialized novel, Little Dorrit, among other things.  An interesting class.  Lots of reading (it's a lit class!) and writing--I couldn't believe how many students complained about the workload.  It's college!  I did my work.  Attended class. Learned a lot.  Got an A.  Loved the class & Dr. G!

19th cent lit wasn't easy with this teacher, but it wasn't hard either. She's very nice, but also has trouble getting you excited as much as she is about the work. If you talk to her, you will do well. Lots of reading, but she was resonable. I'd take her again.
Dropped her class.  Excessive reading required if you're a full time student.  A LOT of writing assignments.  She has a very pleasing accent though.

Excellent professor. I am taking her again next semester. She is compassionate, easy to talk to, and eager for you to participate/share your views. One of the best english teachers I have had at KSU. If you are looking for a good English teacher, I would recommend her.

An easy "A," as long as you do the reading and focus on the areas she suggests.  As far as too much reading:  You people do understand that English classes *require* a lot of reading, right?  Honestly, people, grow up--"revolt?"  That's the silliest thing I've heard in a long time.
The class was really boring, but she was really helpful when you did not understand something.
Expects you to perform at college level, but very helpful and clear. Welcomes open discussion and values students' opinions--in other words, the complete opposite of Morgan.
I didn't like her either.  OK , but not realy interesting. In fact, it was boring.

What is that person talking about? 1.It is a SUMMER class-there's going to be a lot of reading 2.only the lazy and clueless don't do the assignments 3.Post-Colonial Theory falls on the left-not Dr. Gephardt's fault 4.She requires a higher standard b/c this is an UPPER level class--welcome to college, Einstein 5.boring-no, challenging-yes

Gimme a "B"...gimme an "O"... keep going until you spell "BORING!"  It would be preferable to have root canal every day than take this very left-leaning class.  She gives too much reading, so much in fact the class revolted and only 5 actually read the assignment!  She might be good in the lower level classes, but avoid this one like the plague.

Dr. Gephardt is great, she was always willing to help the students and made British Literature, an often boring subject, very intersting. There is a good amount of reading required, but if you come to class and take notes, you should do fine.
She is a very good teacher.  She is always willing to help.  Her tests and quizzes are pretty straight forward.  If you don't like to read a lot I would not recommend taking her.
